content:
• Thursday, August 22, 2013

  • Nikkei jumps, other regional shares higher

    • Japanese shares soar in early trading as the dollar is 0.37% higher against the yen to ¥99.08. The Nikkei is up 2.4% in a broad-based rally.
    • Elsewhere in the region: Kospi +0.7%, ASX +1.2%, Shanghai Composite +0.4%, Hang Seng +0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 PM

  • After-hours top gainers / Losers

    • After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LITB +3%. ANN +3%. SOCB +2%. HZNP +2%. ROST +1%.
    • After-hours top losers: ARO -11%. P -5%. ADSK -3%. YGE -3%. SPHS -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMMU

    More on Immunomedics earnings

    • Immunomedics (NASDAQ:IMMU) FQ4 beats across the board as per share losses decline Y/Y.
    • Total revenue rose 40% Y/Y, primarily due to a $500K jump in R&D revenue from the increase in the number of National Cancer Institute grants as well as the timing of research activities.
    • Shares +1.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • ROST

    Ross Stores +1.8% AH after Q2 beats estimates

    • Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) +1.8% AH after Q2 earnings and revenue come in above expectations, and raised full-year EPS guidance to $3.80-$3.87 from previous $3.70-$3.81.
    • Q2 comparable store sales rose 4% Y/Y.
    • Operating margin grew to a record 13.6%, up from 12.8% in the prior year, driven by a 70 bp improvement in cost of goods sold, mainly due to higher merchandise gross margin.
    • Issues downside guidance for Q3 and Q4; sees Q3 EPS of $0.75-$0.78 vs. $0.79 consensus and Q4 EPS of $0.99-$1.03 vs. $1.10 consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • UEPS

    Net 1 UEPS Techs beats by $0.09, beats on revenues

    • Net 1 UEPS Techs (NASDAQ:UEPS): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $117.88M beats by $3.52M. Shares +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • TBRA

    Regado Biosciences has a solid market debut despite Nasdaq's problems

    • Cardiovascular treatment company Regado Biosciences (RGDO) finish the day solidly higher on its market debut after earlier pricing its 10.7 million share IPO at $4.
    • The offering differed significantly from its original plans. In early May the company disclosed plans to sell around 5M shares at $14 to $16 each. That was later revised to 8.4 shares priced at $5.
    • Trading has been caught up in the afternoon-long trading halt for the Nasdaq exchange, with just over 223,000 shares changing hands through mid-day before trading was suspended.
    • The shares traded as high as $5.39 each soon after the stock opened, seldom trading much below $4.80 a share.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • NDSN

    Nordson misses by $0.04, misses on revenue

    • Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN): FQ3 EPS of $1.01 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $403M (+6% Y/Y) misses by $10.32M. Shares -7.73% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale updates store closure plans, sees Q3 loss

    • Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) tumbles 7.5% AH after reporting a 6% Y/Y drop in sales.
    • Comps growth comes in at -15% for the period.
    • "Our business was pressured by a challenging teen retail environment with weak traffic trends and high levels of promotional activity," CEO Thomas Johnson says, confirming the weakness evident in American Eagle's guidance and Abercrombie's quarter.
    • Q3 outlook: Net loss of $0.21-0.26/ share.
    • The company now plans to close 30-40 stores in FY13 versus previous guidance of 15-20. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk FQ3 guidance light, shares -4.5% AH

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) expects FQ3 revenue of $540M-$555M and EPS of $0.36-$0.40, below a consensus of $580.9M and $0.50. The CAD software giant blames "challenging dynamics" within certain end-markets.
    • In addition, Autodesk isn't providing any FY14 guidance. In May, the company guided for ~3% FY14 rev. growth. The consensus is currently at 2.2%.
    • Platform Solutions & Emerging Business remains a weak spot: revenue -9% Y/Y in FQ2 vs. -6% in FQ1. The same goes for Media & Entertainment, -11% vs. -8%. Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (+6% vs. +4%) and Manufacturing (+2% vs. -4%) are healthier.
    • EMEA revenue -4% Y/Y, Americas, +2%, Asia-Pac -1%. Flagship products revenue -11% to $289M, Suites +18% to $193M, new & adjacent products -1% to $80M.
    • Deferred revenue -6% Q/Q and +7% Y/Y to $806M.
    • CC at 5PM ET. FQ2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale slides on higher Q2 losses

    • Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q2 EPS of -$0.34 misses by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $454.03M (-6% Y/Y) beats by $0.06M. Shares -12.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • P

    Pandora FQ2 results beat, guidance mixed, shares fall

    • Pandora (NYSE:P): FQ2 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $162M (+58% Y/Y) beats by $5.6M.
    • Expects FQ3 revenue of $174M-$179M and EPS of $0.03-$0.06 vs. consensus of $170.5M and $0.08.
    • Expects FY14 (ends Jan. '14) revenue of $640M-$655M and EPS of $0.00-$0.05 vs. consensus of $633.9M and $0.05.
    • Shares -11.6% AH. CC at 5PM ET. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • MRVL

    Marvell beats by $0.04, beats on revenues

    • Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q2 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $807M beats by $15.7M. Shares +4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 5 Comments
  • AAPL

    Icahn's "spoke to Tim" tweet may have helped boost Nasdaq

    • How much of the Nasdaq's move off the trading halt can be explained by Carl Icahn's tweet that he'll be having dinner with Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Tim Cook in September to discuss a share buyback?
    • Ben Berkowitz: Icahn "moved a market that was not even trading."
    • Apple shares are barely in the green near the close, but they had been underwater before the halt.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 9 Comments
  • AFFX

    Affymetrix gains on an upgrade from TheStreet.com

    • Affymetrix (AFFX +3.5%) gets a pop after being upgraded to Hold from Sell at TheStreet.
    • Analysts cite the company's robust revenue growth, solid stock price performance and good cash flow from operations for the upgrade.
    • They stop short of recommending a Buy however, as deteriorating net income and disappointing return on equity serve as a countervailing weakness to the above strengths.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • NDAQ

    Nasdaq moves higher after trading resumed

    • It turns out the trading halt was keeping a lot of buy orders from being executed as the Nasdaq moves back near a session high, +0.95%. The Nasdaq 100 (QQQ +0.9%).
    • The exchange operator, Nasdaq OMX (NDAQ -4.1%), is shown no mercy.
    • Related ETFs: QQQ, QQEW, TQQQ, QID, SQQQ, PSQ, QLD, QQQE.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • NYMX

    Nymox Pharmaceuticals says safety data for NX-207 looks positive

    • Nymox Pharmaceuticals (NYMX +3.1%) says the Safety Monitoring Committee's most recent review of safety data for NX-1207, its drug candidate to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia, found no significant safety concerns to date.
    • NX-1207 is currently is in Phase III development in the U.S. and in the E.U. by licensing partner Recordati SpA.
    • The drug has so far shown none of the adverse sexual side effects associated with previously approved medical and surgical treatments for BPH.
    • Both Phase III trials have completed enrollment and treatment and patient evaluation is continuing at over 70 urology investigative sites across the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • HI

    Davenport starts Hillenbrand at Buy

    • Davenport initiates Hillenbrand (HI +2.8%) at Buy.
    • Price target is $31, representing a 29% upside from Wednesday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • AGEN

    Agenus soars on heavy volume

    • Shares of Agenus (AGEN +9.3%) are sharply higher on above average volume.
    • SA contributor Smith On Stocks says the "biological hypothesis" behind the MAGE A-3 vaccine (which uses AGEN's QS-21 as an adjuvant) is strong and notes that the Phase 3 trial being conducted by GlaxoSmithKline is "extremely well designed and conducted."
    • Ultimately, Smith believes a successful trial could translate to $18M in royalties for AGEN by 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM

  • ICU Medical lands two group purchasing contracts from Premier healthcare alliance

    • ICU Medical (ICUI +1.5%) gains after landing two separate six-year group purchasing contracts from the Premier healthcare alliance.
    • The contracts cover the company's complete line of needlefree IV connectors, sets and accessories.
    • Terms of the deal weren't disclosed.
    • Effective in 2014, will be the first time that group purchasing contracts have separated needlefree IV connectors from IV pump and solution group purchasing contracts, giving Premier member hospitals greater freedom in making clinical decisions based on best patient care and safety.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • GFI

    Analysts say Gold Fields got a good deal in mine purchase

    • The selloff in Gold Fields (GFI -7.8%) shows no sign of abating, even as analysts say GFI got a good deal in its purchase of three western Australian gold mines from Barrick Gold (ABX +2.6%) for $300M; Cowen analysts calculate the mines are worth $513M.
    • GFI is paying the equivalent of $1,137/oz. of output from the mines based on annual production of 452K oz. and the equivalent of $115/oz. for reserves of 2.6M oz. vs. the North American group average of ~$280/oz.
    • An SBG Securities analyst in Johannesburg estimates the price paid per ounce is cheaper than the average paid between 1999 and 2012 in Australia.
    • For ABX, it's "a situation of doing the best you can with a bad hand."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 8 Comments
  • CAL

    Brown Shoe Co. upgraded at Susquehanna

    • Brown Shoe Co. (BWS +4.6%) trades notably higher on the session.
    • Earlier Susquehanna upgraded the shares to Positive from Neutral.
    • Price target raised to $28 from $19.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • COL

    B/E Aerospace responds to Mag Aerospace's patent infringement lawsuit, calling it totally without merit

    • B/E Aerospace (BEAV) responds to a patent lawsuit filed by MAG Aerospace Industries, a unit of France-based Zodiac Aerospace, calling its claims of patent infringement over its Aircraft Ecosystems vacuum toilet "totally without merit."
    • BEAV says the technology and patent suite have been very carefully developed and the MAG Aerospace relevant patents and technology have been cited in its patent applications with the USPTO.
    • The company adds that shipments to Boeing of its modular lavatory systems have begun and will continue.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital wins favorable arbitration ruling, issues Q3 guidance

    • An arbitration panel has ruled InterDigital (IDCC +1.9%) is entitled to royalties from a licensee "at the rates specified in the technology license agreement" between the companies. (PR)
    • The licensee had already paid the amounts sought under protest. They accounted for $52.6M of the deferred revenue on InterDigital's balance sheet at the end of Q2. InterDigital says it's working with auditors to figure out how to recognize the revenue.
    • The 3G/4G IP holder has also issued Q3 guidance. Total revenue is expected to be in a range of $55M-$56M, above a $45M consensus. That figure includes $43M-$4M in current revenue, and $12M in past sales revenue largely stemming from an April arbitration award in a dispute with contract manufacturer Pegatron.
    • Back in May, InterDigital issued strong Q2 guidance on account of the Pegatron award.
    • Shares spiked higher on the announcement, but quickly gave back their gains. They're still outperforming on an up day for the Nasdaq.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • BIDU

    Chinese tech stocks rally following strong PMI print

    • Chinese tech names, already having a spring/summer to remember, are largely outperforming after China's August flash manufacturing PMI came in at 50.1, easily beating a consensus of 48.3.
    • Baidu (BIDU +2%), Dangdang (DANG +6.3%), Vipshop (VIPS +3.8%), Youku (YOKU +3.1%), Sina (SINA +2.7%), and Renren (RENN +2.1%) are among the winners.
    • However, LightInTheBox (LITB -7.9%), which crumbled on Tuesday due to a revenue miss and soft guidance, is adding to this week's losses, and making new post-IPO lows in the process.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • PDCO

    Patterson Companies slips on an FQ1 earnings miss

    • Patterson Companies (PDCO -2.6%) slides after its FQ1 missed estimates across the board.
    • Net earnings slipped 3.5% Y/Y as sales in its main dental-supply business weakened, masking growth in veterinary supply sales.
    • Dental equipment sales -12% to $554.2M.
    • Veterinary supply sales +4.5% at $199.7M.
    • Gross margin narrowed slightly to 32% from 32.1%.
    • The company boosted its FY13 earnings projections, now projecting to earn between $2.13 to $2.24 per share, up from its May range of $2.10 to $2.20 and bracketing Street projections.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • NDAQ

    Nasdaq down but futures open for business

    • The Nasdaq (NASDAQ:NDAQ) has shut down trading, but the futures pits remain open; Nasdaq 100 futures QQQ have dipped to a session low, but remain higher on the day by 0.5%.
    • Related ETFs: QQEW, TQQQ, QID, SQQQ, PSQ, QLD, QQQE.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 16 Comments
  • BTU

    Peabody, Consol on the move as coal tops today's winners

    • Peabody Energy (BTU +5.3%) and Consol (CNX +4.2%) help push the coal sector (KOL +4.5%) to the top of today's gainers, buoyed by signs of a manufacturing recovery in China.
    • Other coal names: OTCQB:PCXCQ +11.2%, YZC +7.7%, WLT +6.5%, ACI +6%, JRCC +5.6%, ANR +5.2%, CLD +3.9%, WLB +2.2%, NRP +1.6%, OXF +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 7 Comments

  • Midday top 10 gainers / Losers

    • Midday top 10 gainers: AFFM.OB +26%. GENE +25%. SUNE +16%. IDSA +16%. AMBI +16%. CNDO +13%. HAIN +12%. GME +12%. HZNP +12%. XOMA +11%.
    • Midday top 10 Losers: ANF -18%. VVTV -17%. OTCPK:MKTY -16%. HPQ -12%. SGOC -10%. OTC:BONT -9%. TAOM -9%. FMAR.OB -9%. DGSE -8%. SHLD -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • RDY

    Dr. Reddy's launches generic version of Depakote ER

    • Dr. Reddy's Labs (RDY +1.7%) trades higher today after saying it has launched Divalproex Sodium Extended-Release Tablets, a generic version of Abbott Laboratories' (ABT -0.2%) Depakote ER mood stabilizers.
    • The Depakote ER brand and its generic counterparts had combined U.S. sales of approximately $194M for the most recent twelve months ending in June 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • SSN

    Samson Oil & Gas slides after reporting allotment and issue of shares

    • Samson Oil & Gas (SSN -5.5%) sinks following an overnight announcement that it completed the allotment of more than 32M ordinary shares together with more than 12.8M free attaching options, a portion of the shortfall from the non-renounceable rights issue which was placed with U.S. investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • GOOG

    Report: Google looking to rent a lot of Best Buy store space

    • Tech pundit and Google Glass evangelist Robert Scoble reports hearing Google (GOOG +0.3%) is planning to rent 6K sq. feet worth of space at every Best Buy (BBY +2.8%) store next year to promote Google Glass.
    • Is Scoble's source off by a decimal? Best Buy's stores have 20K-45K sq. feet of floor space (inc. register aisles and everything else). If the rumor is true, Google would be renting 13%-30% of available space.
    • Regardless, Best Buy appears to be getting a lift from the rumor, as is Glass microdisplay supplier Himax (HIMX +3%).
    • Google already has a Chromebook marketing partnership with Best Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 9 Comments
  • INCY

    Goldman maintains Sell rating on Incyte after Jakafi results

    • "The Street is assigning value to Jakafi in other solid cancers (e.g., lung cancer), which we believe is premature given lack of data and limited visibility on subgroup criteria," Goldman's Navdeep Singh says, regarding the huge run up in shares of Incyte (INCY -4.5%) following the release of data from a Phase 2 pancreatic cancer study.
    • Goldman maintains its Sell rating on the shares.
    • Price target is $26, some 28% lower than Wednesday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics slips despite posting an FQ1 earnings beat

    • Cyberonics (CYBX -2.9%) slips despite an FQ1 earnings beat.
    • EPS were Up 26% from the same quarter last year.
    • Sales were Up 12% year over year, led by strength in Europe.
    • Worldwide unit sales +9.8%.
    • Record U.S. net product sales of $56.4M, +10.8%.
    • For FY14, the company reaffirms its outlook of sales in the range of $279M - $283M and EPS of $1.93 - $2.01, splitting the Street view of $281M in sales on earnings of $1.98 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • PBR

    Rousseff's office denies Brazil is in talks to raise fuel prices

    • A spokesman for Brazilian president Rousseff denies the government is considering raising domestic fuel prices to help Petrobras (PBR +3.4%) after the currency suffered steep losses against the U.S. dollar this week.
    • PBR is selling gasoline and diesel at a ~30% discount to international benchmark prices, with the government reluctant to authorize higher prices for fear of stoking inflation.
    • The problems have been exacerbated by the real's slide vs. the dollar, losing ~8% in August and more than 20% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • ALVR

    Alvarion gives up earlier gains on delay of potential acquisition

    • Alvarion (ALVR +4.1%) gives up the majority of the morning's gains after the company announces that the court-appointed receiver has requested an extension of the operating plan from Aug. 23 to Aug. 30. That plan allows the company to operate as a going concern and carry out a bidding process while in receivership.
    • The stock was up as much as 32.9% before the announcement. Traders betting on an acquisition by Aug. 23 were disappointed.
    • The receiver will "continue discussions with the parties which submitted offers as part of the bidding process to sell the company and/or its assets."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals initiated at Outperform at Oppenheimer

    • Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +2.6%) racks up a solid gain today after Oppenheimer starts coverage with an Outperform rating and a price target of $105.
    • Of note on the technical side: the stock has been trading in a narrow range over the past few weeks, unable to break through resistance at $79.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • EMES

    Kayne Anderson upgraded to Buy at Stifel with23% total return potential

    • Kayne Anderson Energy (KED +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $29 price target at Stifel Nicolaus, which describes a well managed closed-end fund trading at a 13% discount to its estimated NAV while providing an attractive yield of 7%; price appreciation plus yield offers investors a total return potential of 23%.
    • While KED has emphasized private MLPs, it has converted some of those holdings to public companies - such as Emerge Energy (NYSE:EMES), which came public in May at $17 and now trades at $29.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • TTC

    Toro gains on a solid FQ3 earnings beat

    • Toro (TTC +4.8%) gains on a solid FQ3 beat, as strong sales in its residential unit offset declines in its professional products. Results were strengthened by a solid summer growing season, with favorable temperatures and precipitation levels as compared to last year's severe drought conditions.
    • Looking forward, the company says that momentum from productivity efforts and favorable commodity trends should drive additional earnings gains.
    • It's raising revenue growth expectations for FY13, now expecting around 4% growth and net earnings to be about 2.55 per share, a 19% increase over FY12 and above the Street view of $2.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • IRBT

    iRobot's floor-mopping robots hit North America, shares higher

    • iRobot's (IRBT +3.1%) Braava floor-mopping robot line, already available in Europe, is going on sale in North America. (PR)
    • The low-end Braava 320 goes for $200. The Braava 380t, which adds more advanced cleaning and navigation systems, a bigger battery, and other features, goes for $300.
    • The products complement iRobot's well-known Roomba vacuum robot line, which has helped the company sell 10M+ home robots since '02.
    • iRobot shares sold off in July due to the guidance provided with the company's Q2 beat, but remain up 77% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • REGN

    Regeneron initiated at Oppenheimer with an Outperform

    • Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +2.5%) moves up after being initiated at Oppenheimer with an Outperform rating and a $300 price target.
    • The stock has been pummelled this month, losing nearly 14% on the back of a mixed Q2 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • BKE

    Buckle's quarter overshadowed by retail angst

    • Shares of The Buckle (BKE -3.3%) are performing poorly as an in-line quarter can't trump the general malaise gripping the retail sector.
    • Weak guidance out of American Eagle and an abysmal quarter from Abercrombie & Fitch are more than enough to overshadow BKE's comps growth which, in stark contrast to ANF's numbers, came in at +3.2% for the quarter.
    • Net sales rose 7.9%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • EA

    GameStop lifts game stocks

    • Game developers Electronic Arts (EA +2.8%), Activision (ATVI +1.4%), and Take-Two (TTWO +2.4%) are all outperforming after GameStop beat Q2 estimates, issued a strong Q3 same-store sales outlook, and made upbeat comments about holiday season demand.
    • EA and Take-Two are both near their 52-week highs.
    • GameStop's numbers come shortly after Microsoft and Sony announced holiday season game lineups for the Xbox One and PlayStation 4, prior to the start of the Gamescom conference. Sony also boasted PS4 pre-orders have topped 1M.
    • EA made several game-related announcements on Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • TPC

    Tutor Perini wins $61M construction contract from the Wisconsin DoT

    • Tutor Perini (TPC +3.6%) says its Lunda Construction Company has won a $61M contract to construct the DePere-Suamico, Memorial Drive from the Wisconsin Department of Transportation.
    • The contract includes the construction of five new bridges, four retaining walls and related grading and storm sewer work.
    • Construction will start in September and is expected to be substantially completed by May 2015.
    • The deal value will be added to TPC's Q3 reported backlog.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool Works price target raised at FBR

    • Illinois Tool Works (ITW +1.8%) ticks higher this morning after FBR Capital ups its target price on the shares to $85 from $80.
    • The firm leaves its Outperform rating unchanged.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • LXK

    Lexmark falls in sympathy on H-P results

    • Lexmark shares (LXK -5.5%) fall in sympathy after H-P announced FQ3 results yesterday.
    • The main reason? H-P's printer sales fell 3.6% Y/Y and 4.6% Q/Q. (8-K) On the conference call, H-P noted it "[expects] continued pricing pressure in printing."
    • Unsurprisingly, deteriorating industry fundamentals hit Lexmark in Q2, as its hardware sales fell 14% Y/Y. Lexmark's exit from the inkjet business had a 680 bps impact on its Imaging Solutions & Services' division's revenue growth. (10-Q)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • PACB

    Pacific Biosciences rises again

    • Pacific Biosciences (PACB +4.5%) is notably higher in early trading.
    • The shares have had a stellar run this month, rising 63% since August 1 when the company reported Q2 results that, in Piper's words, showed a "renewed sense of stability."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • GOLD

    Barrick upgraded at TD Securities as balance sheet addressed

    • Barrick Gold (ABX +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $25 price target (from $17) at TD Securities as the company works to address balance sheet concerns, including today's $300M sale of three Australia mines.
    • With stress on the balance sheet decreasing, investors can re-focus on ABX's lowest all-in costs of any gold producers and its generation of plenty of cash from operations, the firm says.
    • The Pascua-Lama project remains a risk, but the firm thinks investor scrutiny on the project will subside in the short term as ABX works with Chilean regulators to address water management concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • AVNR

    Avanir: Pseudobulbar found in different neurological conditions

    • A registry of patients with pseudobulbar affect (PBA), a neurologic condition that causes sufferers to laugh or cry uncontrollably, has found that symptoms are common among sufferers of diverse diverse neurological diseases, Avanir Pharmaceuticals (AVNR +3.4%) says.
    • The study also shows that PBA can harm a patient's quality of life. The findings have been published in the peer-reviewed journal, PLOS ONE.
    • Avanir sells Nuedexta, which treats PBA. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • ANF

    Promotional activity taking a toll on teenager-focused retailers

    • There's no sugar coating the awful string of sales reports turned in recently by teenager-focused retailers with today's release from Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -19.5%) one of the worst of the lot.
    • Even retail bulls like Wells Fargo's Paul Lejuez are getting turned around by the high level of promotional activity in the sector. "Nobody is immune," notes the analyst.
    • Decliners: LTD -3.2%, OTC:CACH -1.1%, GPS -1.3%, BKE -1.4%, AEO -1.3%, TLYS -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • MACK

    Paper on Merrimack's Phase II trial of MM-398 drug published

    • The British Journal of Cancer has published a paper about the Phase II trial of Merrimack Pharmaceuticals' (MACK +5.2%) MM-398 drug for treating late-stage pancreatic cancer.
    • The study met its primary endpoint, with 75% of patients surviving at least 3 months, including 25% who reached the one-year mark. The median overall survival was 5.2 months, while 50% of patients showed evidence of disease control.
    • MM-398 is now in Phase III trials. (PR)
    • Last week, SA author Ross Breckendridge noted that Merrimack's share price has been swinging significantly recently in response to interim clinical trial data from MM-121. Breckendridge believes that any downside "has been due to the misconception of the meaning of the data released, and a somewhat poor communication effort by the company."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • RIO

    Global miners rise after upbeat China PMI

    • Global metals and mining stocks trade higher premarket after encouraging manufacturing data out of China; miners tend to rise on growth indications from China as the country is a major user of natural resources.

  • Philippine stocks crumble after three-day break, regional markets weak again

    • Philippine shares (EPHE) slide nearly 6% as trading resumes following a three-day hiatus. The market was closed for rain and flooding on Monday and Tuesday and for a holiday on Wednesday. The sell-off was predictable given the carnage in other emerging markets.
    • Malaysian equities (EWM) fall 1.4% on the heels of Wednesday's current account data which showed a narrowing surplus.
    • Indonesian stocks (IDX, EIDO]]) resume their slide, falling 1.1% after a brief respite yesterday.
    • Thai shares (THD) fall fractionally as foreign investors pull $113M, while Vietnamese stocks (VNM) are weaker by 1.31%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM

  • Market preview

    • U.S. stock futures have been tracking European shares higher all morning following better-than-expected PMI readings in China and the eurozone, with the U.S. reading, which is just out, also beating consensus.
    • The Dow Mini is +0.5%, putting the main index on course to recover a bit from its longest losing run in over a year. The S&P Mini is +0.4%.
    • Treasury yields are down a smidgeon following higher-than-forecast weekly jobless claims. Yields were up earlier.
    • Despite the positive mood, some big names are crumpling following earnings. H-P is -8.2%, as is Sears, while Abercrombie & Fitch is -21%.
    • Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, Leading Indicators, Kansas City Fed Mfg Survey

"We believe the path to $32 gets less linear and a tad bumpier."

  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold's asset sale is the start of promised restructuring

    • Barrick Gold's (ABX) $300M sale of three mines in Western Australia to rival Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) is the start of its promised restructuring, allowing it to concentrate on its five lower-cost mines that already make up 60% of output.
    • The three mines that comprise the Yilgarn South assets produced a total of 452K oz. of gold in 2012 and a further 196K oz. in H1 of this year, but ABX says the sale will not change its full-year plan to produce 7M-7.4M oz.
    • The move switches GFI's main production focus away from western Africa to Australia, where it will bundle assets with its existing mines to try to lower costs.
    • ABX +1.6%, GFI -6.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • MSFT

    Benefits of activism: Sherlund again rates MSFT a Buy

    • Original bull Rick Sherlund (formerly Goldman, now Nomura) puts Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) back on his Buy list due to the "anticipated benefits of shareholder activism." ValueAct owns less than a 1% stake in the company, but is likely to have plenty of support as it presses its case for change says Sherlund. A proxy contest could be a catalyst (the company must be notified by August 30), but the board may just capitulate before that and offer a seat to someone amenable to the activist agenda.
    • He's cutting his EPS estimate as he thinks margins will be talked lower at the September 19 Financial Analyst Meeting, but "We do not think fundamentals matter so much over the next six months."
    • Shares +1.6% premarket.

  • Emerging-market currencies continue to be hit

    • Emerging-market currencies have continued to suffer losses following the release of the latest FOMC minutes yesterday, which provided little clarity about when the Fed might start tapering its QE program but left the market expecting that it will be next month.
    • Ten-year Treasury yields are +2 bps at 2.916%. The recent spike in U.S. debt yields has caused borrowing costs to rise globally, which, along with the rising dollar, has not been healthy for emerging markets with large current account deficits, such as India.
    • USD-INR is +0.5% at 65.045 Indian rupees, with the currency hitting a new low of 65.55 earlier.
